Mon, 20 Nov 2023 07:38:50 +0000https://standupeconomist.com/pdf/misc/interstellar.pdfjamagerhttps://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=38344026https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=38344026 ![CDATA[问 HN：如果你在 ChatGPT 上建立了一家初创公司，你现在有多担心？]]

Over the past year or so, quite a few people built relatively successful, small startups on top of ChatGPT. For those of you who fall into this category or who are in the process of developing/launching a startup that falls into this category, how worried are you after the drama that has unfolded since Friday? Can you give insight as to why you are/are not worried?

Just to clarify, I am not referring to people who had existing startups and added a feature to their startup that uses ChatGPT. I am specifically referring to those people where ChatGPT is central to your startup, and your startup would not exist if not for ChatGPT.

The AI startup wave passed me, so I have no horse in this race. I am also not very clued up on all the AI technologies, so forgive my ignorance. To me, it seems that this would be concerning if I had a startup that existed purely because of ChatGPT.
